column1: Just spoke to @HUDgov @SecretaryCarson & he informed me that more money is coming to the Panhandle for Hurricane Michael disaster recovery soon. Great news for FL-2! #sayfie #HurricaneMichael https://t.co/RIfUNyPce7
.@realDonaldTrump is committed to continuing to strengthen our economy. https://t.co/YSFMClCQoY
To the protesters in Tehran Shiraz and  elsewhere – the Speaker of this House does not speak for many of us. We do not downplay your courage and we stand with you. https://t.co/z3yp5BD1M2

Recently I recognized LTC Daniel Daube an extraordinary three-time war veteran on the House floor. Daube served in WWII Korea and Vietnam in both the Navy and the Air Force and he has left an everlasting mark on Bay County and our country. https://t.co/yKguVLmvzu

This week I honored the life of a true American hero - Captain Dale Doss. Dale Doss will be remembered for his sacrifices and his courageous service to our nation. May he rest in peace. https://t.co/GujSv715w4

.@SpeakerPelosi knows the Articles of Impeachment against @realDonaldTrump are clearly a sham and will fail in the Senate. She has chosen to bypass our governing rules and go rogue by not transferring them to @senatemajldr. https://t.co/yxpwTNR6uW

It’s Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. Thank you to all who put their lives at risk every day and night to keep our families and communities safe. Our law enforcement and first responders run into danger so that others can escape it. https://t.co/xfralRLBw8

In January 2019 @baymedicalctr reopened the hospital with 75 beds following the damages from Hurricane Michael. They have since added an additional 144 beds to bring their total beds to 219 which is full capacity. 2/2 https://t.co/8hlAVOIHtA
On Monday I toured @baymedicalctr  in Panama City with the CEO Heath Evans to see all of the progress that the hospital has made recovering from Hurricane Michael. 1/2 https://t.co/Wg8PRa97Qq

We are monitoring the situation in Iraq tonight as new information comes to light. Please keep our men and women in uniform in your prayers. We have many heroes who are currently keeping us safe while in harms way in the Middle East.

I was honored to meet w/ Col Travis Leighton & Col Brian Laidlaw at @TeamTyndall last week. As we enter 2020 w/ full funding for the reconstruction of the base I was excited to hear about future operations news of approval for additional job hires & plans to restore housing. https://t.co/rL4rWFtcOe
We will continue to work with @realDonaldTrump to ensure our military has the tools to root out terrorism both at home and abroad.

The strikes led to the death of Qassem Soleimani the known terrorist leader of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps-Quds Force. Soleimani was responsible for the deaths of hundreds of Americans and thousands of Syrians. His reign of terror is now over.
@realDonaldTrump's  decisive actions in the Middle East sent a clear message to the world that the United States will not let attacks against our country go unpunished.
Congratulations to Jake and Tiffany Sache on being awarded the State Young Farmer and Rancher Achievement in Agriculture by the Florida Farm Bureau. https://t.co/Rq5tp5gOMu

Recently I honored the life of Mexico Beach City Manager Andy Anderson. Just months ago Mr. Anderson & I met to discuss the rebuild of Mexico Beach following Hurricane Michael. He was dedicated & reflected the resiliency of Mexico Beach. It was an honor to know & work with him. https://t.co/q1WKky2t7g
Happy #Hanukkah to all those celebrating Florida’s Second District! https://t.co/uhdVNJzvuO

This week I honored the life of James Montgomery on the House floor. Mr. Mont will be my missed by his entire community but his legacy and the impact he has made will never be forgotten. https://t.co/i4j1duPvc4
Heading to the House floor to vote against both articles of impeachment. https://t.co/hnP6qWlLrX

We were told this investigation was going to be bipartisan and transparent. Instead these proceedings were held in secret behind closed doors with no attempt at a fair hearing. All this was done deliberately in an effort to undo the results of the 2016 election. https://t.co/MjDshkoddy
The shameful vote today to impeach @POTUS @realDonaldTrump  will be a lasting stain on the House.
We still have a lot of rebuilding to do in the Panhandle but the passage of this tax relief is an important part of the process.

This important legislation allows disaster victims to access money they have saved over the years without facing penalties and temporarily suspends limitations on charitable contributions to our area that are associated with hurricane relief.

The passage of these crucial tax extenders is a big win for Hurricane Michael victims who are still picking up the pieces more than a year later. We finally got routine disaster tax relief across the finish line.  https://t.co/UNAy0rVhdJ
I trust that the Supreme Court will stand by their previous acknowledgment and ensure Florida gets its fair share of water.

Last year the Supreme Court recognized that Florida has been harmed as a result of decreased water flow to the ACF River Basin. They established that Georgia’s unchecked and excessive water usage has harmed Florida and cost us jobs particularly in our oyster industry.
Judge Kelly’s recommendation is very disappointing and completely ignores the decades of damage that Georgia’s water use has had on families and the ecosystem in Florida.   https://t.co/jTrOF10G8j

Just joined several of my colleagues in the House in a moment of silence to honor the lives lost in the terrible attack at Naval Air Station Pensacola last week. We continue to pray for the families and friends of the three sailors who were tragically killed. https://t.co/weDALjAUmX

Our men and women in uniform repeatedly suffer the consequences of a divided Congress and are forced to keep us safe with outdated equipment and technology. This important legislation works to reverse years of underfunding.

It also gives certainty to the Panhandle that Tyndall Air Force Base will be fully rebuilt and includes my legislation requiring the Secretary of Defense to provide a report to Congress on the future of Artificial Intelligence in DoD.
While the passage of this vital legislation to support our military is long overdue I am pleased that we could get this done before Christmas.  https://t.co/8X7Zv1U2fb

Jeff Jones Azucena Gonzalez Amber Thompson Selena Perez Courtney Anderson Tobie Peterson Taryn O'Hara Kassidy High Jake Wooley and Tiffany Fields for sharing your gifts with us to admire. 3/3 https://t.co/QN9zGmHJ42

These students’ display is a testament to their special talent. Thank you to students James Howard Karen Arreguin Ava Forehand Padyn Chaney Kelsey Little Paige Smith Kaylee Medina Addison Elliott Alana Combs Tori Lane Christina Taylor Lucy Jolicoeur Kersten Dye 2/3 https://t.co/A5M2GpuK4m

Congratulations to Suwannee High School for being recognized for the ornaments they decorated. Art students in Mrs. Pamela Williams' class carefully crafted the ornaments' designs & the National Park Service chose them to be displayed on the Florida tree at the White House. 1/3 https://t.co/mRjJDJhYHM
Thank you to our first responders law enforcement and the U.S. Navy for your quick response. Your bravery saved countless lives.

Today the Naval Air Station Pensacola community experienced a tragic shooting. We are continuing to monitor the situation and we are praying for all who were affected by this tragedy. Violence of any kind is never acceptable.

It was an honor to join the @RedCross today & send holiday cards to our service members. Many in our military miss spending the holidays with loved ones because they are fighting for our freedoms at home & abroad. Thank you to all who work to keep us safe! https://t.co/gxNtChOgnC
This Thanksgiving Leah and I served meals at Tyndall Air Force Base. Thank you Colonel Laidlaw for the opportunity to express my sincere appreciation for our airmen and those who support the base.

Happy Thanksgiving! Thanksgiving is an opportunity to recognize and appreciate all that we hold dear. I am especially grateful for all of our troops as they have dedicated their lives to ensure our safety and the ability to enjoy our most basic freedoms.

We discussed the future of USAF & USCG projects in the district & challenges the two services expect in the coming years. We also discussed different ways we could do more to help mitigate future challenges. Thank you Mr. Hyden & Rear Admiral Schofield for a great discussion.

Our communities are still recovering from the devastation of Hurricane Michael. The Air Force & Coast Guard face specific challenges when attempting to rebuild their bases. Last week I hosted a roundtable with Mr. Brent Hyden with USAF & Rear Admiral Doug Schofield with USCG. https://t.co/JQYQmdRZUl
I want to hear your thoughts on our health care system. Take my survey --> https://t.co/ATbNqHcWnU 2/2

As a surgeon with more than 30 years of experience I have seen first-hand the challenges in our health care system. I believe we must enact reforms to lower the costs of health care & ensure medical decisions are a matter between you & your doctor. 1/2

I had a great time meeting with Swift Creek Middle School Students before they toured the Capitol today. These 8th grade students from Tallahassee are spending the week exploring Washington and putting all of their US history knowledge to the test! https://t.co/CW3pAmNwkb
The American people deserve transparency and the truth. Instead Democrats in the House are wasting time and money with their partisan politics. https://t.co/VsLBZFkuoF

As the son of a veteran the father of a veteran and a veteran myself I am committed to ensuring our veterans are getting the care they need and deserve. Thank you to America's veterans. https://t.co/qWQiCL3wYA

On Veterans Day we honor every individual who has dedicated themselves to serving our nation during wartime and during peace. Though this day is a remembrance it should also serve as a reminder to honor the veterans in our lives and our communities every day.
Happy 90th Birthday to Bobby Bowden who led FSU to victory in two national championships and twelve ACC titles during his coaching career. He is a legendary Nole! #GoNoles

These block grants will provide much-needed relief. I was happy to work with colleagues in Congress and Secretary Perdue to ensure that the necessary resources flow to North Florida to revitalize our timber industry. https://t.co/b8T8mNTW8H

The timber industry is vital to North Florida and unfortunately it took a hard-hit last year. Secretary Perdue’s announcement is welcome news. Our Florida foresters are our best environmental stewards and their livelihood depends on smart and sustainable conservation practices.
I want to hear your thoughts on the impeachment proceedings against President Trump. Take my survey -->  https://t.co/bbyRmEYGkC

Recently I honored the courageous efforts of Sgt. Jeff Hewitt & Dep. Jared Hewitt of the @fcsofl in the Congressional Record. These 2 officers went above & beyond during the Eastpoint fire & were named the 2019 Law Enforcement Officers of the Year by the FL Sheriff's Association. https://t.co/RpjRW9CqFh

The reason they haven’t presented any evidence is that they have none. This ‘Soviet style justice’ is an insult to our democracy. This investigation would not stand up in any court in the United States and should not stand up in the House of Representatives. #ImpeachmentVote

This vote is more political theatre as Nancy Pelosi & House Democrats try to backtrack and validate the tainted process of their partisan witch hunt against President Trump. Their goal has been impeachment since November 9 2016. They want to undo the election. #ImpeachmentVote

This is a big win for America and for all those fighting terrorism. Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi was one of the worst terrorists in the world. His death sends a message that the United States will continue to fight until all ISIS terrorists are brought to justice. https://t.co/KOMxRDLCcR

Today we honor the first responders across our nation who run into danger every day to keep us safe. Thank you for your dedication and service. Your sacrifices do not go unnoticed. #NationalFirstRespondersDay https://t.co/yaWz77Gr1k

Yesterday I dropped my leftover prescriptions off at the DEA office in DC during their Drug Take Back Day. On Saturday locations across the 2nd District of FL will serve as National Prescription Drug Take Back Day collection sites. Learn more here —> https://t.co/Q9Ym5hPHSh https://t.co/wK1X6WLWJB

This impeachment inquiry is a sham. Adam Schiff has refused to release to the public the transcripts & even refuses to let members of Congress into the hearings. Their goal has been impeachment since the 2016 election & they will use any means to get there. #StopTheSchiffShow https://t.co/VX2a4KUQmc

On Tuesday I sat down with @DeptVetAffairs Sec Robert Wilkie & discussed the implementation of the VA MISSION Act which builds upon the success of the VA Choice Program by streamlining community care programs so a veteran can access care outside of the VA when they need to. https://t.co/tHS3EL0AK1

Chairman Elijah Cummings dedicated much of his life to public service representing the people of Maryland with grit and grace. I extend my deepest condolences to his family and friends during this difficult time. May he rest in peace.

The Congressional App Challenge is in full swing. The CAC is a programming competition for students in high school & younger. Students individually or in teams are tasked with creating coding and implementing a new and innovative computer application. https://t.co/PXMpq0NPne

It’s unconscionable that Speaker Pelosi is arbitrarily choosing to impeach the President w/o holding a single vote to do so. It’s un-American and flies in the face of the Constitution. I fully support President Trump’s decision and condemn Nancy Pelosi’s "impeachment by decree."

Speaker Pelosi’s partisan impeachment proceedings are a farce and an effort to overturn the 2016 election. Even worse they will continue to stand in the way of Congress getting anything meaningful done for the foreseeable future.

Last Friday I rode around with the Mexico Beach Chief of Police Anthony Kelly. Great witnessing the progress of the city despite the Category 5 hurricane that made Mexico Beach known as “ground zero.” I admire the resilience of this great community. Thank you Chief Kelly. https://t.co/TjjIIbkpEe
Great event in Florida today with @realDonaldTrump - we will keep fighting in Congress to #KeepAmericaGreat https://t.co/cBvHGzi3Yn

It was great to see many local contractors & friends at the Bay County Contractors & Associates event this week. The BCCA always does an outstanding job advocating for local contractors. I was even able to catch up with @GovRonDeSantis & discuss Hurricane Michael relief. https://t.co/qvPnZO2Toy

It was an honor to be present at Lake City Medical Center as Mayor Stephen Witt read a proclamation for Breast Cancer Awareness Month. I then joined LCMC CEO Rick Naegler Dr. Hayes and others to discuss the issues they are facing in providing health care to North Florida. https://t.co/nOYPgEpGxK
Great catching up with the Olin’s while in Lake City. Really thankful for the recovery of James Jr. after his recent accident. https://t.co/sX7GFDi0mo

Thank you to Ricky Gamble Suwannee County Commissioner District 3 for the informative tour of the Suwannee Santa Fe and Ichetucknee Rivers this weekend. We discussed the rivers' ecosystems and economic development in the area. https://t.co/UnyqF0Csun

It's official - @verizon is launching 5G in Panama City TODAY! After Hurricane Michael Verizon made a commitment to help us rebuild & today they followed through. PC is the first 5G city in FL & one of the first 30 in the country. Thank you to all who worked to make this happen! https://t.co/LRNMBzZKFm
My statement on Democrats’ baseless impeachment inquiry into @POTUS @realDonaldTrump —> https://t.co/ORL7HNtpSE

The Florida Sheriffs Youth Ranches have been improving the lives of at-risk children in 6 locations. Without action the Title IV-E child welfare waiver will expire. It's our responsibility to ensure that vital services to children & families are not interrupted. https://t.co/l61dDqP8r9

It’s clear the system to provide emergency funding to disaster victims is broken. By streamlining the federal disaster response we can take politics out of the equation & help the people across our country who are hurting. https://t.co/VxstUA50j4

The Congressional App Challenge is in full swing. The CAC is a programming competition for students in high school & younger. Students individually or in teams are tasked with creating coding and implementing a new and innovative computer application. https://t.co/P7UyHqf7PT

The US changed forever on 9/11. As we remember & reflect on that dark day we find hope in knowing that America is resilient. Let us say a prayer for our first responders & heroes across our country who today like 18 years ago run into danger to save their fellow Americans. https://t.co/cqYLMoyLl2

It is imperative that everyone remain vigilant & make necessary preparations. Please make your preparations now and listen to the warnings of local officials. You can follow the latest news and see what resources are available here: https://t.co/SYdiO6iizk

We have been in constant contact w/ federal state & local leaders about Hurricane Dorian. While an exact path remains unknown we have learned from hard experience that we must prepare as if it is headed for us.

On Monday I met with Kristy Terry and Kevin Yoder of the North Florida Inland Long Term Recovery Group. This recovery group has been working very hard for Calhoun and Jackson County since Hurricane Michael hit. You can check out their website at https://t.co/fal8Pkk4hb. https://t.co/AXYJC3S7uU

Thank you to the Farm Credit of Northwest Florida for all of your hard work on behalf of the farmers throughout the second district. I enjoyed meeting with you all and gaining additional insight on the challenges you have faced following Hurricane Michael. https://t.co/UGBoeb13BP

On Wednesday we toured the new Super-Pufft Snack Corporation facility in Perry. Brothers Walid & Mahmoud Amrouch have been working very hard to get this business up and running. I was honored to have the opportunity to meet Walid Mahmoud & their fathe. https://t.co/uxopVPQub3

We were treated to an informative tour by Campus President Maria Mead Vice Chancellor of Community Relations and Student Advancement Belinda Keiser and Dean of Academic Affairs Shyam Mistry. https://t.co/btHq0SvH2G

We also toured the Keiser University campus in Tallahassee yesterday. We met with two students Army veteran Charles Persall and nursing student Chasity Jones. Keiser University in Tallahassee offers programs in nursing information technology business and more. https://t.co/uSVd8wDJeB

I always enjoy meeting with the Kiwanis Club of Perry and hearing about the issues that are most important to Taylor County. Yesterday we discussed lessons learned from last year’s hurricane season and my upcoming tour of the district with USDA Under Secretary Bill Northey. https://t.co/fsrBXFDpHv

I had a great time speaking at the BBIA Lunch at the newly built Horsley Construction building. We discussed Hurricane Michael recovery & my bill addressing the housing crisis. Thank you to all of the BBIA members who are working hard to rebuild homes & businesses in Bay County. https://t.co/sHMyWt0NEH

He did this same run in reverse back in 2013 at the age of 90 where he ran from San Diego CA to Saint Simons Island GA in 999 hours 32 minutes & 1 second. We had a great time hearing Ernie’s stories and hope he is able to meet his goal. Learn more --> https://t.co/C5ANz1UzVQ https://t.co/0HFqYJ6oS8

It was an honor to attend WWII vet Ernie Andrus’ 96th bday party at Blondies Food & Fuel in Grand Ridge. Ernie is currently running across the country to raise money to get the last remaining operational LST 325 (WWII ship) back to Normandy & turned into a D-Day Memorial. https://t.co/oLhInHzLTs

The @WhiteHouse has released info on how to apply to decorate serve as a greeter during a Holiday Open House or apply to perform during the holiday season. The WH is truly a magical place during the holidays & I encourage all who are interested to apply! https://t.co/fTxOnUPGvc

Our flight line at Tyndall is now capable of servicing this mission and is the only site in the Southeast U.S. capable of handling some of the more demanding maintenance issues with this unique aircraft.

This week I urged Acting Secretary of the Air Force Matthew Donovan to consider resuming F-22 training temporarily at @TeamTyndall until Joint Base Langley-Eustis is prepared to fully accommodate that training mission. Read more --> https://t.co/L3EVIiQmRV
James Sommers dedicated his life to bettering the lives of those throughout North Florida. Suwannee County has lost a great man. May he rest in peace.  https://t.co/A9L06g4oqa

It’s clear the @usairforce & @POTUS recognize the importance of investing in @TeamTyndall as we modernize our warfighters. I look forward to continuing to work with the defense community to bring these squadrons in for a landing.

Today @realDonaldTrump & @VP reaffirmed their commitment to fully rebuilding @TeamTyndall for the 5th generation fighter by 2023. This announcement gives certainty to our airmen at Tyndall & to the Panhandle as we continue to rebuild from Hurricane Michael. https://t.co/4yPRsn7BfY
#BuildTheWall https://t.co/kCpXn42MTe

.@realDonaldTrump was elected in part to protect our southern border. While Democrats have refused to recognize the need to do so I’m pleased that the Supreme Court has. Today we are one step closer to building the wall. #BuildTheWall   https://t.co/6pis83uTCx
This deal cements the rebuild of Tyndall Air Force Base as well as aid programs providing relief to the Panhandle which are still very necessary.

President Trump and I would both prefer greater spending reforms but we cannot allow perfect to become the enemy of “the good.” Nor do we want our men and women in uniform to suffer under sequestration.

Last night I stood with President Trump and voted in favor of the budget deal at his very specific request. We share a desire to rebuild our military after years of neglect under the Obama Administration and this deal continues that progress.

While I was in DC for votes members of my staff attended the ribbon cutting for Talquin Electric Cooperative’s New Operations Center in Crawfordville. This new space will house office space for staff as well as storage space for equipment. Congrats to Talquin Electric Coop! https://t.co/84aaXZtwp6

This week I honored the life of Harry Weaver a Suwannee County resident army veteran & lifelong educator who passed away last month. Throughout his life Harry served our country & our youth in various capacities all across Florida and overseas. May he rest in peace. https://t.co/l5rwlrmxiO

It’s no wonder Congress’ approval rating is so low – we waste time and money on political theater. Speaker Pelosi – it’s time to get to work we were not sent to Washington to attack President Trump’s Cabinet with wasted votes. 2/2

We are over 6 months into a Democrat House majority & what have we accomplished? Instead of focusing on debt ceiling negotiations or working to aid our communities recovering from disasters the Dems are forcing us to vote to hold 2 more members of the Trump Admin in contempt. 1/2

Yesterday I spoke at the 8th Annual Future Space Leaders Event in Washington. These young professionals are truly inspiring and are paving the way for the United States to make new strides in space exploration. https://t.co/gFzxJ79oPh
Madison Rogers of Marianna High School won 3rd place in the 2019 Congressional Art Competition with her artwork titled "Blue Glass Still Life." Congratulations Madison! https://t.co/rZRzKJNLPB

I was able to secure crucial funding for the rebuild of Tyndall Air Force Base and provide relief to our farmers. I will continue to work with Chairman Griffitts and the Bay County Commission to ensure that the Panhandle get the funding it needs to rebuild. 2/2

This morning I had the opportunity to update the Bay County Commission on federal disaster relief. Four weeks ago we finally got disaster supplemental funding for Hurricane Michael across the finish line. 1/2 https://t.co/ch4o5oifmG
CBP & the medical professionals down on the border need the funding we passed this week more than ever. 2/2

On Friday I traveled down to our southern border to evaluate how we are responding to the medical issues faced by those crossing into the US. As you can see resources are stretched thin and they are doing the best they can with what they have. 1/2 https://t.co/VlHWgpED8T

We have a humanitarian crisis at our border & yet House Democrats refuse to bring up the bipartisan border funding passed by the Senate 84-8. I just asked for unanimous consent to bring up a vote on the Senate bill and was denied. https://t.co/eG5OSw8Xej
Congrats to @MosleyHigh and Panama City Beach native @BledayJay and @VandyBoys for their College World Series win last night!

Kate Kirchhoff the 2019 Congressional Art Competition winner for the Second District was in Washington this week to be honored by the Congressional Institute. Kate's artwork is now hanging in the Capitol for all visitors to enjoy! https://t.co/12ft8UaHrI
This week I joined Bay County in honoring a local hero with the naming of June 18th as SSgt. Clifford Chester Sims Day. https://t.co/Cgrssqiivc

Last month I announced the winner of the 2019 Congressional Art Competition - Kate Kirchhoff. Over the next several weeks I will be showcasing all of the other talented 2019 artists. The 2nd Place winner was Madison Retherford of Marianna HS w/ her artwork titled "Billie." https://t.co/zRcFMM1aqY
Happy birthday @POTUS @realDonaldTrump!
Congrats to @FSUBaseball on an outstanding win! Next stop: college World Series! https://t.co/4CO6mYaDoV
Thank you @realDonaldTrump - with your help the Panhandle will come back better than ever! https://t.co/ijtRUSXfjR
He made a commitment to North Florida – he promised to help us rebuild. With his ongoing support and this much-needed disaster relief funding we will continue to rebuild the Panhandle. 6/6

Over the last 7 months I stood on the House floor the Capitol steps in countless hearing rooms & even on Air Force One demanding that the victims of Hurricane Michael not be forgotten. While many in Washington forgot about the Florida Panhandle @realDonaldTrump did not. 5/6
We were also able to secure funding for the many farmers ranchers and timber producers who suffered terrible losses in the storm. 4/6

With his help I successfully secured $1.7 billion in military funding that will be instrumental in jumpstarting Tyndall Air Force Base’s rebuild and restoring military readiness and training operations. 3/6

This is a shameful example of putting politics before people and Democratic leadership’s willingness to hold funding hostage over their hatred for President Trump. I’m thankful for President Trump’s unwavering support. 2/6

After almost eight months Congress has finally done its job and passed a disaster aid bill for the people of North Florida. Never in our nation’s history has it taken so long to do the right thing following a devastating natural disaster. 1/6

Tonight we will vote to pass disaster aid and send it straight to @POTUS @realDonaldTrump desk. The folks in the Panhandle have waited far too long for this much-needed disaster funding. https://t.co/zzuMYuT5pG
On this Memorial Day I ask you to find a way to give of yourself to remember those who gave their lives so that others might live. That way they can never be forgotten. Thank you. 3/3

“Their lives remind us that freedom is not bought cheaply” President Reagan said. “It has a cost; it imposes a burden. And just as they whom we commemorate were willing to sacrifice so too must we -- in a less final less heroic way -- be willing to give of ourselves.” 2/3

From the first volleys at Lexington in 1775 to the latest patrol in Afghanistan this Memorial Day we pause to remember those brave Americans who made the ultimate sacrifice in the service of their country. 1/3 https://t.co/PoZmwFfApI

Congress has a duty to the American people to ensure the federal government can function properly. It is time to correct course and do the right thing for the people of the United States that have waited far too long for our help.

.@SpeakerPelosi and .@SenSchumer have once again moved the goal post on getting disaster relief to Americans across the country. Today I urged them to come down to the Panhandle and see the devastation for themselves. #HurricaneMichael #sayfie  https://t.co/6K0VBQdI1X

Congratulations to Kate Kirchhoff - the 2019 Congressional Art Competition winner from the Second District! Kate is a junior at Lawton Chiles High School and won with her artwork titled "Feather Head." https://t.co/ranW8ZqAco https://t.co/NzyQyhtpZy

100 years ago today the House  passed the 19th Amendment to the Constitution guaranteeing women the right to vote. Today I join with many of my colleagues in wearing a yellow rose to honor the suffragists who fought tirelessly to ensure equality at the ballot box. #WomensVote100 https://t.co/cU3Mufncu9

Congratulations to  @Chipola_BSB for winning their third straight State Title over Northwest Florida. Good luck later this month in the Junior College World Series – bring it home to the Second Congressional District!  https://t.co/8MT3FFdDuJ

The American Farm Bureau Federation works hard to represent farmers across this country and ensure that their voices are heard in Washington. I am honored to receive the Friend of Farm Bureau award for my work on the House Agriculture Committee fighting for Florida farmers. https://t.co/VxyGRDFWrV

I had a great time meeting w/ FL reps from @ACPinternists. We discussed high prescription drug prices & lack of access to affordable health care coverage. I always encourage physicians to get engaged & advocate for their patients & that is exactly what these doctors are doing. https://t.co/PUTUs7aubQ
It's National Police Week. Thank you to all of our law enforcement officers for all that you do to keep us safe. #PoliceWeek https://t.co/bauDfPZ7dy
Happy Mother's Day to all the moms in the Second District. Your hard work and compassion is the key to future generations of good people. https://t.co/OjCeWayEZy
I urge the Senate to immediately take up a disaster supplemental and work with the president to provide much needed relief to those in need.  https://t.co/BJ9rxfu26f

It is our duty to help our fellow Americans in need. This disaster relief bill also included my amendments to increase funding to our armed services. Our military readiness is in crisis and will continue to be if we do not provide the necessary resources to our armed services.

While less than we worked for this disaster supplemental is a step in the right direction. It has been over 200 days since Hurricane Michael destroyed the Panhandle & yet the resilient people in N Florida have had to suffer without adequate disaster relief from the federal govt.

Happy National Nurses Week. I have worked with many outstanding nurses throughout my life who have gone above and beyond for their patients. Thank you to all who work tirelessly as nurses - you are true heroes. https://t.co/Mu4MIoYjho
Our military is suffering because we haven't passed disaster relief funding. It's time to pass a disaster supplemental - we cannot wait any longer. https://t.co/CvugWJPzWr

It was great to see @CityofPanamaCty Mayor Brudnicki City Manager McQueen & @BDS_Supt up in DC today fighting for disaster relief. By working together & continuing to bring attention to Hurricane Michael devastation I believe we can get disaster relief across the finish line. https://t.co/4xFsd6OYsF

I was able to attend the West Florida Electric Cooperative meeting while members of my staff thanked our linemen at Gulf Coast Talquin and Suwannee Valley Electric Co-ops. Thank you to all of the linemen in North Florida! 2/2

Today electric cooperatives across the Second District held their annual meetings . They joined with their members and local communities to recognize the hard work of our linemen as they worked around the clock to restore powers to areas hit by Hurricane Michael. 1/2 https://t.co/4WdjeA6zoi
Congratulations to Charles Thomas of Suwannee County for being recognized this week for his years of service with Florida Farm Credit. https://t.co/XP92cjBZjx

Last week I had the opportunity to recognize Major Bonnie Francis of the @usairforce for her more than 40 years of service. Major Francis is currently the Health Care Integrator for the 325th Medical Group at Tyndall Air Force Base. https://t.co/DQpKTZXkMn

Happy Easter to all - I hope you are blessed to be spending this day with your family and friends. During this season of reflection and renewal please pray for our men and women in uniform first responders law enforcement and all who are away from their families today. https://t.co/shD3YH6uyE
May all of our Jewish friends across the world have a happy and blessed Passover. Chag Sameach! https://t.co/tEAuhfJfBl

If my Democrat colleagues are serious about pursuing wrongdoing I would encourage them to look here. The American people have lost trust in the Justice Department and AG Barr is taking meaningful steps to ensure that it is restored.

Throughout this investigation there have been clear ethical violations that have put our national security at risk. AG Barr has stepped up during his short time as the head of the Justice Department and launched extensive investigations into the practices of the DOJ and the FBI.

AG Barr also confirmed the Special Counsel had full cooperation of the White House throughout his investigation. Unfortunately Dems will never be happy w/ the truth & they have made it clear that they will continue to waste time & resources until they create the result they want.

The House voted unanimously to release the report & that is exactly what the AG has done. By working directly w/ Special Counsel on necessary redactions I believe he has more than fulfilled his promise & it is time for Dems in Congress to end their witch hunt & get back to work.

I commend Attorney General Barr for his timely release of the findings of Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s investigation and for his commitment to transparency for the American people. I look forward to reviewing the report over the coming days.
